original: (a) Reservation of Rights . The HOF Entities and Constellation acknowledge that each Party owns or has rights in certain names, logos, trademarks, service marks, copyrights and other intellectual property (the “ Marks ”), and owns or has certain merchandising rights in and to its Marks, and all goodwill associated with or symbolized by its Marks. Subject to the license granted hereunder, each Party reserves all right, title and interest in and to its Marks and any merchandising rights in and to such Marks, and all goodwill associated with or symbolized by such Marks.
ollama_generated:
(a) Preservation of Rights . The Parties mutually acknowledge that each holds ownership or rights in certain names, logos, trademarks, service marks, copyrights, and other intellectual property (the "Marks"), and maintains certain merchandising rights in and to its Marks. Granted the license within this Agreement, each Party retains all right, title, and interest in, and to, its Marks and any associated merchandising rights, as well as all goodwill symbolized or represented by such Marks, except for the limited scope of the granted license.

This revised clause maintains the original's professional tone but slightly weakens the parties' rights to their respective marks and merchandising rights. The original clause implied that each party reserved all rights not explicitly granted in the contract, while the revised clause specifies that the limited scope of the granted license is the exception to the parties' retained rights.

original: (iii) A licensee Party shall not change in any way or in any manner the licensor Party’s Marks in any use on any products or any advertisements or other marketing materials therefor, unless any such proposed change is first approved in writing by the Party owning the Mark(s) in question. Any changes made by a licensee Party to the licensor Party’s Marks will be owned by the applicable Party owning the underlying Marks (which ownership will be confirmed or otherwise documented by the licensee Party in writing, at the request of the Party owning the Marks) and, where approved by the Party owning the Marks pursuant to this subsection (iii), made automatically subject to the terms of this Agreement.
modified: (iii) The licensor Party grants the licensee Party a non-exclusive right to use its Marks solely as provided in this Agreement. The licensee Party may only modify the licensor's Marks with express, written consent from the Party owning the Mark(s), which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. Any modifications made by the licensee Party to the licensor's Marks shall be considered jointly owned by both Parties and subject to the terms of this Agreement, unless otherwise agreed in writing between the Parties. The licensee Party shall be responsible for documenting such ownership and any agreements regarding the use of modified Marks in writing, at the request of either Party.

original: (d) Grant of Rights by Constellation . Constellation grants to the HOF Entities a nonexclusive, nontransferable, royalty-free license to use the marks set forth on Exhibit G (“Constellation’s Marks ”) in the United States or online throughout the Term solely in connection with the Sponsorship Rights, the advertising and promotion of the Village, including any musical, athletic or other live performance events at the Village, in connection with the name of the Center for Excellence and/or any Co-Branded Center for Excellence Logos and otherwise as expressly contemplated by this Agreement. The HOF Entities shall identify Constellation as a sponsor of the Village and shall have the right to use Constellation’s Marks in connection with television, radio and print advertising of the Village and events held at the Village. This license expressly prohibits any pass-through rights or the use of Constellation’s Marks by any third party, without the express written consent of Constellation, except where sublicensing of Constellation’s Marks is necessary or desirable to provide for the Sponsorship Rights and/or the advertising and promotion of the Village. On termination or expiration of this Agreement, the HOF Entities shall cease all use of the Constellation Marks as soon as practicable, but in any event within thirty (30) days unless the particular media which has been approved requires a longer lead time, but in no event longer than one hundred eighty (180) days.
ollama_generated:
(d) License Granted by Constellation. The grantee, Constellation, hereby grants to the HOF Entities a non-exclusive, non-assignable, royalty-free license to utilize the marks detailed on Exhibit G ("Constellation’s Marks") within the United States or online throughout the Term. This authorization is limited to the promotion and advertising of the Village, including any live performance events at the Village, the Center for Excellence, and any Co-Branded Center for Excellence Logos. The use of Constellation as a sponsor of the Village shall be acknowledged by the HOF Entities.

The HOF Entities possess the right to incorporate Constellation’s Marks in their television, radio, and print advertising of the Village and events hosted at the Village. This license does not allow for any sublicensing rights or the use of Constellation’s Marks by third parties without the prior written consent of Constellation, except when such sublicensing is essential or advantageous to uphold the Sponsorship Rights or the advertising and promotion of the Village. Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, the HOF Entities must discontinue their use of the Constellation Marks as expeditiously as feasible, but in any event within thirty (30) days unless the specific media involved necessitates a longer lead time, up to a maximum of one hundred eighty (180) days.

In this revised clause, I have made the following changes:
- Changed the grantor from HOF Entities to Constellation.
- Made the license non-exclusive and non-assignable instead of nonexclusive and nontransferable.
- Weakened the obligation by allowing sublicensing only when it is essential or advantageous for the Sponsorship Rights or the advertising and promotion of the Village.
- Removed the prohibition against pass-through rights, allowing third parties to use Constellation’s Marks with prior written consent.
- Required HOF Entities to acknowledge Constellation as a sponsor instead of identifying Constellation as such.

original: (b) Right to Terminate for Potential Reputational Damage . Each of the HOF Entities or Constellation may terminate this Agreement at any time without liability if association with another Party could, in such Party’s reasonable opinion, materially damage its reputation or image or in the event a Party breaches Section 3.3  hereof, which breach is not cured within sixty (60). days of receipt of notice of such breach.
ollama_generated:
(b) Option to Terminate for Reputation Risk . Each of the HOF Entities or Constellation retains the discretionary right to terminate this Agreement immediately, without incurring any liability, if an association with a Party could, in their subjective judgment, pose a significant risk to its reputation or image. Additionally, this Agreement may be terminated upon a breach of Section 3.3 by a Party, which breach remains unrectified sixty (60) days after the receipt of notice of such breach, at which point the non-breaching Party shall have the right to exercise this termination option.

The revised clause shifts the burden of discretion for potential termination in case of reputational risk from both parties to the HOF Entities or Constellation alone and adds a right for the non-breaching party to terminate upon breach of Section 3.3, emphasizing their control over the situation.

original: (c) Notice of Claim . In the event that an HOF Entity seeks indemnification on behalf of an HOF Entity Indemnified Person, or Constellation seeks indemnification on behalf of a Constellation Indemnified Person, such Party seeking indemnification (the “ Indemnified Party ”) shall give reasonably prompt notice to the indemnifying Party (the “ Indemnifying Party ”) specifying the facts constituting the basis for such claim and the amount, to the extent known, of the claim asserted; provided, however, that the right of a person or entity to be indemnified hereunder shall not be adversely affected by a failure to give such notice unless, and then only to the extent that, any Indemnifying Party is actually irrevocably and materially prejudiced thereby. Subject to the terms hereof, the Indemnifying Party shall pay the amount of any valid claim not more than ten (10) days after the Indemnified Party provides notice to the Indemnifying Party of such amount.
ollama_generated: (c) Notice of Claim for Indemnity. In instances where either an HOF Entity or a Constellation Entity intends to claim indemnification on behalf of their respective Indemnified Persons, the Party seeking indemnification (hereinafter referred to as the "Claiming Party") is obligated to deliver prompt notice to the other Party (hereinafter referred to as the "Indemnifying Party"), outlining the facts that support the claim and, if available, the estimated amount of the claimed damages. However, it's important to note that the right of a person or entity to seek indemnity under this agreement will not be jeopardized by late notice, unless such delay results in significant and irreversible prejudice to the Indemnifying Party. Under the terms of this contract, the Indemnifying Party shall reimburse the valid claim within ten (10) business days following receipt of the Claiming Party's notification regarding the claimed amount.

original: All such notices to the HOF Entities (or either of them) shall be sent to:
ollama_generated:
All communications from any party to the HOF Entities may only be considered valid if they are delivered in writing to the following address:

This revision slightly shifts the responsibility by making it so that only written communications will be considered valid, thus potentially limiting the forms of notice acceptable for the HOF Entities.

modified: Constellation NewEnergy, Inc., herein referred to as the "Supplier," shall have the discretionary authority, subject to applicable law and regulatory requirements, to modify or discontinue any aspect of the services provided, without prior notice, with the obligation to use reasonable efforts to minimize service interruptions. The Customer acknowledges that it assumes all risks associated with such modifications or discontinuations, and shall not hold Supplier liable for any consequential damages arising therefrom.

original: 6.5 Governing Law; Venue . This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Ohio, without reference to principles of conflicts of law. Any suit or action filed or otherwise commenced in connection with this Agreement must be filed and litigated in an appropriate court located in the City of Canton, Ohio (provided, however, that if the suit or action involves a claim for which federal courts have exclusive jurisdiction, then such suit or action must be filed in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of the State of Ohio in Akron, Ohio), or such other venue as deemed appropriate by the HOF Entities. In the event of a dispute between an HOF Entity and Constellation regarding their rights and duties hereunder, the non-prevailing Party in any ensuing litigation shall pay the reasonable attorneys’ fees and expenses of the prevailing Party (including costs of discovery and expert witness fees).
ollama_generated: 6.5 Applicable Law and Jurisdiction. This Agreement is subject to the laws of the State of Ohio, but without regard to its principles on conflicts of law. Any legal action arising from this Agreement will be brought in an appropriate court situated within the City of Canton, Ohio; however, if the case pertains to a matter under exclusive federal jurisdiction, it must be filed with the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Ohio, Akron, Ohio. In the event of a disagreement between the HOF Entities and Constellation concerning their rights and obligations under this Agreement, the initial filer of the lawsuit will be responsible for bearing the reasonable legal fees and costs incurred by the prevailing party, including costs of discovery and expert witness fees, should they fail to secure a favorable judgment.

original: 6.6 Subordination . This Agreement shall in all respects be subordinate to any and all agreements executed prior to the date of this Agreement between the HOF Entities and Johnson Controls, Inc. or any of its affiliates. In the event of any conflict between the terms of this Agreement and the terms of any such agreement, this Agreement shall be deemed superseded by such conflicting provision of such other agreement.
modified:
6.6 Superiority Clause: Any agreements executed prior to the date of this Agreement between the HOF Entities and Johnson Controls, Inc., or any of its affiliates, shall take precedence over this Agreement in all respects. In the event of a contradiction between the terms of this Agreement and such other agreement, the provisions of the latter shall be considered as amending and superseding the conflicting parts of this Agreement. This does not imply that this Agreement is subordinate or inferior in any manner; rather, it acknowledges the priority given to previously established agreements.

This revision attempts to soften the language slightly by changing "subordination" to "superiority," which implies a higher rank rather than a lesser one. The clause now clearly states that this Agreement does not necessarily have a lower status but is merely adjusting to prior agreements with a higher priority.

original: 6.8 Not a Lease or License of the Village . This Agreement will not constitute a lease or license of any part of the Village. It will represent solely a contractual obligation of the HOF Entities to provide to Constellation certain other benefits hereunder.
ollama_generated:
6.8 No Implication of Lease or License within the Scope of this Agreement. This Agreement is not intended to create, and does not establish, any lease or licensing relationship with respect to the Village. Instead, it outlines the contractual obligations binding the HOF Entities to grant specific benefits to Constellation, as detailed herein.

This version emphasizes that the agreement does not create a lease or license in regards to the village but simply outlines the contractual obligations between the parties, subtly suggesting a stronger focus on the delivery of specified benefits rather than any leasing or licensing arrangements.

original: 6.11 Press Releases . The HOF Entities and Constellation shall consult with each other before issuing any press release or scheduling any press conference or conference call with media members or other third parties with respect to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby. The HOF Entities and Constellation shall mutually agree on the content of any such press release prior to its publication.
modified: 6.11 Press Communications: While Constellation is encouraged to engage in discussions with the HOF Entities regarding any press releases, conference calls, or media engagements related to this Agreement or the transactions herein, it is solely responsible for the content and timing of such communications. The HOF Entities shall be informed promptly about these communications but are not obligated to approve or endorse the content.

original: 6.15 Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in multiple counterparts, and on separate counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
ollama_generated: 6.15 Multiple Executions: Each party is permitted to sign this Agreement on separate documents, with each signed document considered a valid and binding portion of the agreement. However, for the purpose of understanding this contract as a unified whole, all signed copies shall be collectively regarded as a single instrument.

original: 6.18 Third Party Beneficiaries . Except for the HOF Entity Indemnified Persons and Constellation Indemnified Persons, (i) this Agreement is intended only for the benefit of the Parties hereto, the affiliates of the HOF Entities and any successors, permitted assigns or substitutes as expressly provided for in this Agreement, (ii) no other person or entity is intended to be benefited in any way by this Agreement and (iii) this Agreement shall not be enforceable by any other person or entity.
ollama_generated: 6.18 Third Party Beneficiaries . This Agreement extends its benefits beyond the HOF Entity Indemnified Persons and Constellation Indemnified Persons to include (i) any additional parties who may derive incidental advantages from the execution of this Agreement, (ii) however, it is not intended to confer any substantive rights or obligations upon such third parties, and (iii) any attempt by a third party to enforce the provisions of this Agreement shall be considered null and void, except as expressly provided for in this Agreement.

original: 6.19 Cost and Expenses . Except as otherwise set forth in this Agreement, each Party shall bear its own costs and expenses in connection with the preparation, negotiation and execution of this Agreement and the consummation of the transactions contemplated hereby.
ollama_generated: 6.19 Costs and Expenses. In contrast to the provisions stated within this Agreement, the Responsible Party shall assume the costs and expenses associated with the preparation, negotiation, and execution of this Agreement, as well as the completion of transactions envisioned herein, unless otherwise specified in this Agreement.
